messageBody:
reply_das@... wrote:
> But, doesn't this break encapsulation in a way? In this application,
> I do not think any other client classes will be interested in picking
> and choosing nodes and checking its contents. They would only send
> messages to the TreeHolder and let the TreeHolder delegate it on.

Yes, encapsulation is weakened. There have been several long threads in
this group on this particular topic; mayby you should check the archive.
Your options are:
(1) Making the methods public or package scope
(2) Use reflection to access hidden features
(3) Change your testing strategy towards MockTreeNodes

I prefer option 1 as long as it is simple and straightforward. I never
use option 2 and use option 3 in all other cases.

Johannes
